meanings.def: to become smaller, weaker, etc.; to make something become smaller, weaker, etc.
examples: The world's resources are rapidly diminishing.
His influence has diminished with time.
diminish something The new law is expected to diminish the government's chances.

meanings.def: to make somebody/something seem less important than they really are
examples: I don't wish to diminish the importance of their contribution.
The trial has aged and diminished him.

meanings.def: used to refer to a point at which you start achieving less than the value of the time or money you put into something
examples: Our efforts were producing diminishing returns.
In general, the more exercise you take, the greater the health benefit; but beyond a certain level you get diminishing returns.
